name.description: The name of this Kong instance.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each instance.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each task.

role.description: Deploy Kong only on nodes with this role.

use-cassandra.title: Use Cassandra as Kong datastore?
use-cassandra.description: If true, Cassandra is used as Kong datastore.

contact-points.description: A comma-separated list of contact points.

port.description: The port on which cassandra nodes are listening on.

log-level.description: Log level of the Kong server.

custom-envs.description: A space-separated list Kong configurations. Please avoid updating properties which already being set through other properties above.

external-access.title: Allow external access
external-access.description: Enable or disable creating a VIP for external access through a public node running Marathon-LB.

vip-port.description: Port number to be used for communication internally to the cluster. Default is 8000.

virtual-host.description: The virtual host address to integrate Kong proxy port with Marathon-lb.

https-redirect.description: Whether Marathon-lb should redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This requires 'virtual-host' to be set.

service-port.description: Port number to be used for external traffic to cluster through Marathon-LB load balancer.
